So its been a busy week!

I finally found a job at Blockbuster. All my Hollywood experience paid off, though its only paying $8/hour. That's fine for now. As long as I get enough hours, I think I will be fine. There was two reasons why I wanted to get a part time job, if I couldnt find full-time work. First, I can get money to help pay off my bills and put a bit towards the wedding. Right now, Melissa is paying my bills until I got a job, and now I do. If you know me, you know how much I hate other people paying for me, so basically, her paying my bills for June was absolute torture. Second, I NEED TO GET OUT OF THIS HOUSE. Seriously....

I did get offered another position. I got offered to be a GM (game master) for World of Warcraft. That would be my #1 dream job. I mean come on! Being paid $10/hour and getting raises to play games and help people in the game start out and work out bugs. That=amazing. Only one problem......Its in Austin TX. I couldn't leave Melissa in Madison, waiting for her to come down to Austin and hope to get a job. I mean, if the job was in Chicago, that might be a possibility. But then again, Chicago is only 2 hours away. Austin is a 17 hours away. She needs a job down there. Who knows if that'll ever happen. So I am not getting my hopes up.

In the mean time, I am looking at getting a few things. I decided I don't want to teach. I am planning on going to school to get my A+ certification and then start out getting my programming certifications in .NET and Java. Maybe I can get a job where I will fit in, like a software company instead of somewhere I won't, like a marketing company. I mean, one of the reasons I really want a job as well is to start making friends. When I moved here, I had no friends but Mel. Since I got here, it hasnt improved. I love Melissa, but I really need my own friends that I can talk to face to face. Her friends don't really like me, me thinks. And thats fine. Just strengthens my resolve to find my own friends. 

Melissa told me last night that she can't do any housework around the house because I am around and shes worried that im not being entertained. So, she wants me to leave on saturday so she can clean the house. I guess I'll go out and see a movie. We are going to see WALL-E tonight, so maybe I'll see Wanted tommorrow?

So Im actually posting because this has been the first time in about a year that I actually have had time to post. Nuts. So, here I am, in Madison, WI. It's kinda freaky to move in with someone, espicially because I just have this feeling that it is not my house. Melissa assures me it is, but I haven't paid anything into it, so it just doesn't feel like home. 
    I went through student teaching last semester. It was fun, and the kids were mostly great. I am convinced that 90% of your classroom will be great, but you will always have that 10% who just don't care and will make your job a living hell. I am having a huge problem with teaching, tho. Throughout student teaching, I got really high marks for everything, from core knowledge, to building rapport with students, to lesson planning. Everyone kept coming up to me and saying "you're a natural!" I just don't feel like teaching is my calling. I got that feeling early in student teaching that it just was NOT what I wanted to do. I just felt awkward the whole time, and maybe its because it wasn't really my classroom, but I just felt like this wasn't what I wanted to do the rest of my life. Maybe my true calling is teaching college? I don't know. I have always wanted to do something with computers, but have always shied away because of my lack of math skills. Perhaps its time to do what my Uncle Richard did and just love history, but go into computers. I'm thinking about taking classes and getting my Master's in computer engineering. It's always been a love of mine, and it'll help me get a job.
    Speaking of getting a job, I can't get anything in Madison. There are no teaching jobs for Social Studies, no computer tech jobs (I had an interview with Melissa's company but they decided to go in a "different" direction), and no part time jobs open yet. So I'm just sitting around, waiting...for something to happen.
    I think one of the hardest things about moving in with Melissa (by the way, I in no way regret moving in with her) is leaving all my friends behind. I think at William and Mary, I had some of the tightest friendships of my entire life. And now they're gone. Clay tells me that we'll never be gone as long as we have IM and everything, but not seeing them on a daily basis hurts. I really miss them and I could use their help now.
   Life certainly is funny like that, though. It strikes hard right when you're the most vulnerable. My grandfather has 6 types of cancer (lung, brain, kidney, colon, pancreatic, and lymph). He is terminal and will go any day now. My friends and family are gone, I can't find a job, I'm in an unfamiliar place. I just don't know what to do anymore. The only thing that sustains me is Melissa, and I can't wait until she gets home at 5. 
  Planning this wedding is harder than I thought. We have looked at different places and finally chose the Four Seasons. The problem was the alcohol, but I think we have that covered. Now, the only thing I can do for the next 6 months (wedding wise) is save up money and I need one more groomsman. That space is and always is reserved for Chris. I left him a message about 2 weeks ago, and couldn't call him before that because I got a new phone. If Chris says yes, the space is his, if not, I'll leave it empty. 

Just waiting for a job now. Call me or IM me. I'm not doing anything.

I broke up with chrissy today. I didnt do it out of malice, or because I hate her, or because my dad forced me, or bc someone forced me. I did it because i think itll be the best thing for both of us in the long run. I just cant commit the kind of emotional and mental output that is needed for a relationship right now. I really wish people could understand my motives, but i prob will get that "hate" IMs or the "explain why" IMs that i hate so much. I did it, why do you need a why? I feel horrible. I feel like the lowest kind of existance. Its so bad that I dont even feel like im here. But I know it would be worse if I stayed. Sure, things would have been fine for a few more months, at least we got back to W&M, and it may start out with an arguement, and it will escalate, and escalate, and then we would break up and wouldnt even be able to be around her anymore. I dont want that. Like chrissy, Im just sad right now, not because i want her back, because that would be a mistake, but because it was over so quickly, for so much time and emotion we both invested in it. 

Also I put up an away message. Ive never had such a response to my away b4 (i didnt even know ppl stalked my profile THAT much) It said RIP David and Chrissy and 1/4/05-5/29/06. For some odd reason, ppl thought this was insensitive. I dont get it. I didnt mean it that way. I didnt know how quite to tribute our relationship. I wasnt rubbing it in that I broke up. I wanted a tribute for the public on a good, long lasting relationship, at least for me. 

I dont expect ppl to understand why i did it. And i already feel like a jerk. Im going away for a few days. Hopefully chrissy and i will feel better when i get back.

And chrissy, like you said, "We'll Always Have Philly" shes right, we had some great times. I choose to remember that.

Im really kind of bored here in the library I dont really have much to do because i have a two hour break, and no one i know has lunch at the same time I do. THIS SUCKS! So without further adooo.......Im presenting my Best Films of the Half Year!

Best Picture: Batman Begins

Runner Up: Cinderella Man

By far the best movie this year has got to be Batman Begins, for the simple fact that the last 2 Batman's blew monkey, and this one was good. And when I say good, I mean great. It had a good combo of action and drama. It didnt try to make Batman Campy, like the last two did. In fact, since Tim Burton and Michael Keaton stopped doing Batman, it has gone from bad to worse. Batman, in the new movie, doesn't even show up until half way through the movie. We find out where Batman gets all this gadgets (from Morgan Freeman, of course, who has been in every other movie this year), how he learned all his martial arts moves (from Liam Nieson of course, who learned them from Rob Roy), and How his parents died, finally (not in clouded afterthoughts) It was well directed, well acted, and gave a new sense of villans. They are redoing the series and although I love jack Nicholson as the Joker, im ready for a new one if it means a great movie.

Cinderella Man was a great movie about the Depression and one mans struggle to come to terms with the reality of his situation to get one more fight to put food on the table. It is a great tale of survival and the endurance of the Human soul. Russell Crowe, again, is amazing in it and should get an Oscar Nod.

Best Action Movie: Batman Begins

Runner Up: Ong-Bak: Thai Warrior

For Batman Begins, see above

With marvelous movies like Sin City and The Island (roll eyes here) how can Ong-Bak, a foriegn movie be best Action movie. Because, its a martial arts movie with not many special effects and pure action. It doesnt have the Beauty of a movie like Crouching Tiger or House of Flying Daggers, but it does have Wing-Chun style combantants, and plus, there hasnt been a good Martial Arts movie, in my opinion, in a while. (Sorry Mark, War of the Worlds didnt make the list)

Best Comedy: Wedding Crashers

Runner Up: Mr & Mrs. Smith

Wedding Crashers is by far the FUNNIEST movie of the year. Forget Guess Who, or the Longest Yard or whatever stupid David Spade movie came out this year. This movie is just plain funny. Im not a huge fan of Vince Vaughn since Dodgeball (although it was pretty funny) and Owen Wilson isnt too funny either, though he was hilarious in Zoolander, but it was still Ben Stiller who stole the movie. This movie starts as 2 men crash weddings strictly to sleep with women. They have rules and they have it down to a science. All until Owen Wilsons character falls for this chick during a high class wedding. All through the movie are sex jokes (Did u motor boat?) and strictly non-sex jokes (Why do we have to wear camaflouge?) But whether you see it with your girl, or you see it alone, one thing is certain.....SEE IT.

Mr & Mrs. Smith is one of those movies you have to see with a significant other. The way these two interact is just so like married couples. In fact, it is my belief that if all people were secret agents, that this is probably the way they would end up.

Best Science Fiction: War of the Worlds

Runner Up: Star Wars: Episode III: Revenge of the Sith

War of the Worlds was a pretty good interpretation of the book. I was impressed, not only with Tom Cruise, but also with Dakota Fanning. The Special Effects for this movie were great, and will win it a Nod for the Oscars. A lot of people thought that the end cooped out, but hey, thats the way H.G. Wells intended, although im sure they could have done a lot more with the ending. But then again, what do you want with a summer movie. The best scene in the movie wasnt any special effect, but was the battle on the hill, and you know something is going on over the hill, but you dont know what. A brilliant piece of directing in an age where everyone must show everything (see horror movies for this example)

Star Wars finally got it right this year. I dont know if it was the set up from the previous 2 movies or the fact that Jar Jar Binks was no where in the movie. George Lucas finally cut out all the racial and children movie crap from the movie, gave haydn christianson some acting skills, and turned out a good 3 and a half star movie. Everything that had to come together did. You see Yoda vs the Emperor, a fight waiting to happen, Obi Wan vs Darth Vader...Rd. 1. How Anakin turns to the dark side, why Luke and Leia are kept from Anakin and the reason all the Jedi die out. It kind of is a quick way to kill all of the jedi, the way it happened, but there wasnt any other real way to do it. The lightsaber battles are more than enough of a reason to see this movie. That and seeing Sam L. and his badass purple lightsaber.

Best Horror/Suspense Movie: Hostage

Runner up: Hide and Seek, Red Eye

Hostage did the trick. Its a smart suspense that keeps you guessing the whole way through. You dont know how its going to work out, if Bruce Willis can get out with his family intact, why the robbers chose that house....etc. It seems confusing, with all the different questions that need to be answered, but thats the mark of a good Suspense movie.

Before I get into these next two, let me give u my opinion on Horror movies. They suck. There hasnt really ever been a good horror movie in year (Since the Ring and before that, who knows) Horror movies have been reduced down to the Boogeyman concept...ok beginning and then sux at the end. To be honest, I can only think of 3 good modern horrors, The Mothman Prophesy, The Ring, and Idenity, and Idenity was ok until the end. It, like Saw, was a suspense, not a horror. Hide and Seek was a good suspense/horror, but still not a classic horror movie. Red Eye, straight up suspense, nothing else.

Honorable Mention:  The Jacket

Best Romantic Movie: Hitch

Runner Up: Guess Who, Fever Pitch

Hitch, besides the Notebook, is the ultimate romantic movie. If you just want to sit at home and watch a movie with your signifcant other, Hitch and Guess Who are the movies. Hitch is probably one of the best movies of the year. It came out in Feb. and shows that even fat men have a chance at the best looking girls ( beauty in the eye of the beholder in this movie) but still. It involves Alex Hitchins, a date doctor who sets up desperate men with attractive women . All he needs is 3 dates. And he does it. There are all sorts of great rules for dating in here, even if you didnt think about it before. It has great comedy and youll be quoting it for hours (i come 90 and u come 10).

Guess Who is a remake of Guess Whos Coming to DInner, with Sidney Portier. Its great with Bernie Mac, and will have you remembering good times (if your married) if youre not married, then its a good movie for when you first met your girlfriends dad (you have forced me to use the muscle). Classic.

Best Documentary: March of the Penguins

Runner Up: Born into Brothels, Super Size Me

 No im not doing this because my girlfriend is totally obsessed with Penguins. It is an honest, truly heartwarming story. Its acutally rated G, so its kid safe. Its not just a tale told by Morgan Freeman, its a tale of love and survival in the most unlikely place an organism can survive. Some of the scenes are tremedous, and babies are cute, and it is a feel good film.

Born into Brothels won the Academy Award last year for Best Documentary, in the absence of Michael Moore's stunning "Farenheit 911." This is good and bad. Its good because it allowed Born into Brothels to be recognized, but bad because a piece so truthful didnt get more recognition. Born into Brothels is about the poor children of India, and how a women takes photos and has them create pictures in order for them to get money for education. Its very sad, but heartwarming at the same time. I though that Super Size Me would have won, but born into brothels was a great movie in its own right

Runner Ups: Constantine, National Treasure, Million Dollar Baby, The Interpreter, Kinsey, Kung-Fu Hustle, Fever Pitch, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

 And in a surprise finish, Robots is perhaps the best movie of the year (so far) It has a great collection of voices, has great comedy and doesnt go too over the top, like the Wedding Crashers. It actually teaches something, which is something kids movies seriously lack. Everyone needs to see Robots.....seriously. You wont regret it.

Some of these other ones are biases. Constantine, National Treasure, and Fever Pitch are biases bc they are all great movies about my intrests. Just because im into history doesnt mean i like all history movies ( See Kingdom of Heaven). must sees are the interpreter, and Charlie. These two esp. are fantastic.
